Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Review the Provided Temporal Profile and Context: Process Steps: R -> A -> E -> P -> N -> C. Data: (R, A): 1 hour, 10 min STDEV. (Standard) (R, E): 1 day, 8 hours STDEV. (Standard) (R, P): ~1 day (25h), 1 hour STDEV. (Suspicious: Low STDEV) (A, C): 2 hours, 1 hour STDEV. (Suspicious: Very fast closure.) (E, N): 5 minutes, 1 minute STDEV. (Suspicious: Too fast.) (E, C): 1 hour, 50 min STDEV. (P, N): 7 days, 2 days STDEV. (Suspicious: Long wait.) (N, C): 30 minutes, 5 minutes STDEV.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Drafting Part 1: Anomalies Identification: Item 1: R to P: Average ~25 hours with a very low standard deviation. Item 2: P to N: Average 7 days with a high standard deviation (2 days). Item 3: A to C: Average 2 hours with a 1-hour standard deviation. Item 4: E to N: Average 5 minutes with a 1-minute standard deviation.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Drafting Part 2: Hypotheses: Hypothesis 1 (P to N): Manual notification is often a bottleneck. Hypothesis 2 (R to P): The rigid timing could be due to a pre-approval algorithm. Hypothesis 3 (A to C): Ghost claims or direct closure option. Hypothesis 4 (E to N): Manual data entry errors or automatic approved upon evaluation.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Drafting Part 3: SQL Verification Queries: Goal 1: Identify claims where time between activities is outside expected ranges. Query: CTE for R time, P time. Calculate difference. Goal 2: Correlate anomalies with resources/claim types. Goal 3: Filter specific patterns (A to C fast, P to N slow).

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Final Polish of content: Self-Correction on SQL: Calculating duration between arbitrary ordered activities requires a window function. Query 1: Detecting R to P Anomalies. Query 2: Detecting A to C Speed. Query 3: Correlating Anomalies with Adjusters/Regions.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Final Review against constraints: No per instructions text? Yes. Identify anomalies? Yes. Hypotheses? Yes. SQL queries? Yes.
